com.netcracker.edu.java.tasks

Interface CurriculumVitae


  • public interface CurriculumVitae
    GOALS
    • To learn regular expressions (including groups), java.util.regex and java.lang.String.
    • To practice object-oriented programming and using Java Collections Framework.
    • To get used to throwing Exceptions in every case when it's required but with minimal number of throw statements.

    TASK
    Implement a class storing a single CV text (curriculum vitae, resume) with ability to update some CV parts.
    Getter methods of the class return names and phone numbers taken from the CV; update* methods change the last name and a phone number directly in the CV text.
    The class can also hide and unhide some personal info in the CV.

    REQUIREMENTS

    • An appropriate exception should be thrown in each method (excepts for setText(String)) if the CV does not contain valid information required by the method.
    • To implement hiding/unhiding feature, an appropriate class from the Collections Framework should be chosen.

    NOTES

    • If you want to check you class in your main() you may copy a text of any real-life CV, paste it to a plain text editor like Notepad in Windows, save it to a file and load the file in your main().

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  CurriculumVitae.Phone
      This class stores information about a phone number.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getFirstName()
      Returns the first name from the CV (the first word of getFullName()).
      java.lang.String getFullName()
      Returns the full name i.e. the FIRST part of the CV text that satisfies the following criteria: full name consists of 2 or 3 words separated with a space (' '); each word has 2 or more characters; the first character of the word is upper-case Latin letter (alphabetic character); the last character of the word is either '.' or lower-case Latin letter; non-first and non-last characters of the word can be lower-case Latin letter only.
      java.lang.String getLastName()
      Returns the last name from the CV (the last word of getFullName()).
      java.lang.String getMiddleName()
      Returns the middle name from the CV (the second word of getFullName()) or null if the full name has two words only.
      java.util.List<CurriculumVitae.Phone> getPhones()
      Returns a list of phones in the same order they occur in the CV.
      java.lang.String getText()
      It is recommended to call this method in all the other methods of you class.
      void hide(java.lang.String piece)
      Finds the piece in the CV text and replaces piece's characters with 'X' character, excluding the following separating characters: ' ', '.' and '@'.
      void hidePhone(java.lang.String phone)
      Finds the phone in the CV text and replaces all DIGITS of the phone with 'X' character.
      void setText(java.lang.String text)
      Sets the text (the main field of the CV).
      int unhideAll()
      Undoes all changes made by hide(String) and hidePhone(String) methods i.e. replaces 'X' pieces of the current CV text ("hidden" pieces inserted by those methods) with appropriate pieces of the original CV text.
      void updateLastName(java.lang.String newLastName)
      Replaces the lastName to newLastName in the CV text.
      void updatePhone(CurriculumVitae.Phone oldPhone, CurriculumVitae.Phone newPhone)
      Replaces the oldPhone.getNumber() to newPhone.getNumber() in the CV text.

    • Field Detail

      • PHONE_PATTERN

        static final java.lang.String PHONE_PATTERN
        This is a regular expression to use in getPhones(). It describes multiple phone number formats like US, Russian and Ukrainian formats (for large cities); it does not match the UK and France formats.
        The expression does not include a country code. An area code (3 digits) and an extension (1 or more digits after "ext" or "ext.") are optional. The number of digits in a number matching to the expression is not less than 7. Examples of numbers matching the expression: "(916)125-4171", "495 926-93-47 ext.1846", "800 250 0890"
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • setText

        void setText(java.lang.String text)
        Sets the text (the main field of the CV).
        Implementation note: The text should not be analyzed in this method.
        Parameters:
        text - CV text

      • getText

        java.lang.String getText()
                         throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        It is recommended to call this method in all the other methods of you class.
        Returns:
        The current text of the CV (may be changed by update* methods).
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the CV text was not set by setText(String).

      • getPhones

        java.util.List<CurriculumVitae.Phone> getPhones()
                                                throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Returns a list of phones in the same order they occur in the CV.
        Implementation note: Use PHONE_PATTERN to find phones; use groups of that regular expression to get area code and extension from the matches found; if the area code or extension does not exist there, the Phone must store negative value of it.
        Returns:
        A list that can't be null but may be empty (if no one phone is found).
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the CV text was not set by setText(String).
        See Also:
        CurriculumVitae.Phone

      • getFullName

        java.lang.String getFullName()
                             throws java.util.NoSuchElementException,
                                    java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Returns the full name i.e. the FIRST part of the CV text that satisfies the following criteria:
        1. full name consists of 2 or 3 words separated with a space (' ');
        2. each word has 2 or more characters;
        3. the first character of the word is upper-case Latin letter (alphabetic character);
        4. the last character of the word is either '.' or lower-case Latin letter;
        5. non-first and non-last characters of the word can be lower-case Latin letter only.
        Returns:
        The full name (is exactly equal to its value in the CV text)
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - If the CV does not contain a full name that satisfies the criteria.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the CV text was not set by setText(String).

      • getFirstName

        java.lang.String getFirstName()
                              throws java.util.NoSuchElementException,
                                     java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Returns the first name from the CV (the first word of getFullName()).
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - If the CV does not contain a full name.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the CV text was not set by setText(String).

      • getMiddleName

        java.lang.String getMiddleName()
                               throws java.util.NoSuchElementException,
                                      java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Returns the middle name from the CV (the second word of getFullName()) or null if the full name has two words only.
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - If the CV does not contain a full name.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the CV text was not set by setText(String).

      • getLastName

        java.lang.String getLastName()
                             throws java.util.NoSuchElementException,
                                    java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Returns the last name from the CV (the last word of getFullName()).
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - If the CV does not contain a full name.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the CV text was not set by setText(String).

      • updateLastName

        void updateLastName(java.lang.String newLastName)
                    throws java.util.NoSuchElementException,
                           java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Replaces the lastName to newLastName in the CV text.
        Parameters:
        newLastName - Can't be null
        Throws:
        java.util.NoSuchElementException - If the CV does not contain a full name.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the CV text was not set by setText(String).
        See Also:
        getLastName()

      • updatePhone

        void updatePhone(CurriculumVitae.Phone oldPhone,
               CurriculumVitae.Phone newPhone)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                        java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Replaces the oldPhone.getNumber() to newPhone.getNumber() in the CV text. Implementation note: using regex here leads to more code than using non-regex methods of String (or maybe than using non-regex method of String and a method of StringBuilder).
        Parameters:
        oldPhone - Can't be null
        newPhone - Can't be null
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the CV does not contain a text equal to oldPhone.getNumber().
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the CV text was not set by setText(String).

      • hide

        void hide(java.lang.String piece)
          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                 java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Finds the piece in the CV text and replaces piece's characters with 'X' character, excluding the following separating characters: ' ', '.' and '@'. The number of 'X' characters is equal to a number of the replaced characters.
        For example: "John A. Smith" is replaced by "XXXX X. XXXXX", "john@hp.com" - by "XXXX@XX.XXX".
        This change can be undone by unhideAll().
        Parameters:
        piece - Can't be null
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the CV does not contain a text equal to piece.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the CV text was not set by setText(String).

      • hidePhone

        void hidePhone(java.lang.String phone)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                      java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Finds the phone in the CV text and replaces all DIGITS of the phone with 'X' character.
        For example: "(123)456 7890" is replaced by "(XXX)XXX XXXX".
        This change can be undone by unhideAll().
        Parameters:
        phone - Can't be null
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If the CV does not contain a text equal to phone.
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the CV text was not set by setText(String).

      • unhideAll

        int unhideAll()
              throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        Undoes all changes made by hide(String) and hidePhone(String) methods i.e. replaces 'X' pieces of the current CV text ("hidden" pieces inserted by those methods) with appropriate pieces of the original CV text.
        Note: there can't be 2 (or more) equal hidden pieces (equal pieces with 'X') in the CV text.
        Implementation note: original and hidden pieces should be stored in some collection. Moreover, the collection should be cleared on setText(String).
        Returns:
        The number of replacements made in the CV during unhiding
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - If the CV text was not set by setText(String).
